verses.kjv: At that time, saith the LORD, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of his princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves:
verses.web: “At that time,” says LORD, “they will bring the bones of the kings of Judah, the bones of his princes, the bones of the priests, the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves.
verses.ct: "When that time comes," says the LORD, "enemies will dig up the bones of Judah's kings, its officials, the priests, the prophets, and the ordinary people of Jerusalem right out of their graves.

verses.kjv: And they shall spread them before the sun, and the moon, and all the host of heaven, whom they have loved, and whom they have served, and after whom they have walked, and whom they have sought, and whom they have worshipped: they shall not be gathered, nor be buried; they shall be for dung upon the face of the earth.
verses.web: They will spread them before the sun, the moon, and all the army of the sky, which they have loved, which they have served, after which they have walked, which they have sought, and which they have worshiped. They will not be gathered or be buried. They will be like dung on the surface of the earth.
verses.ct: They'll scatter those bones under the open sky — exposed to the sun, the moon, and the stars that these people loved, served, followed, consulted, and worshiped. No one will gather those bones up or rebury them. They'll lie on the ground like dung.

verses.kjv: And death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue of them that remain of this evil family, which remain in all the places whither I have driven them, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: Death will be chosen rather than life by all the residue that remain of this evil family, that remain in all the places where I have driven them,” says LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: And the survivors of this wicked nation — scattered to every place where I've driven them — will wish they were dead rather than alive," says the LORD of Armies.

verses.kjv: Moreover thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the LORD; Shall they fall, and not arise? shall he turn away, and not return?
verses.web: “Moreover you shall tell them, ‘LORD says: “ ‘Do men fall, and not rise up again? Does one turn away, and not return?
verses.ct: "Tell them this as well: The LORD says, 'When people fall down, don't they get back up? When someone wanders off the path, don't they turn around and come back?

verses.kjv: Why then is this people of Jerusalem slidden back by a perpetual backsliding? they hold fast deceit, they refuse to return.
verses.web: Why then have the people of Jerusalem fallen back by a perpetual backsliding? They cling to deceit. They refuse to return.
verses.ct: So why do the people of Jerusalem keep sliding further and further away and never stop? They cling to their lies and refuse to come back to me.

verses.kjv: I hearkened and heard, but they spake not aright: no man repented him of his wickedness, saying, What have I done? every one turned to his course, as the horse rusheth into the battle.
verses.web: I listened and heard, but they didn’t say what is right. No one repents of his wickedness, saying, “What have I done?” Everyone turns to his course, as a horse that rushes headlong in the battle.
verses.ct: I've listened carefully, but not one of them speaks honestly. No one repents of their wickedness and asks, "What have I done?" Instead, everyone charges ahead on their own path like a horse rushing headlong into battle.

verses.kjv: Yea, the stork in the heaven knoweth her appointed times; and the turtle and the crane and the swallow observe the time of their coming; but my people know not the judgment of the LORD.
verses.web: Yes, the stork in the sky knows her appointed times. The turtledove, the swallow, and the crane observe the time of their coming; but my people don’t know LORD’s law.
verses.ct: Even the stork in the sky knows when it's time to migrate. The turtledove, the swallow, and the crane all follow their seasons. But my people don't know the laws of the LORD.

verses.kjv: How do ye say, We are wise, and the law of the LORD is with us? Lo, certainly in vain made he it; the pen of the scribes is in vain.
verses.web: “ ‘How do you say, “We are wise, and LORD’s law is with us?” But, behold, the false pen of the scribes has made that a lie.
verses.ct: How can you say, "We are wise — we have the law of the LORD"? The truth is, the lying pen of the scribes has twisted it into a lie.

verses.kjv: The wise men are ashamed, they are dismayed and taken: lo, they have rejected the word of the LORD; and what wisdom is in them?
verses.web: The wise men are disappointed. They are dismayed and trapped. Behold, they have rejected LORD’s word. What kind of wisdom is in them?
verses.ct: Your so-called wise men will be put to shame. They'll be horrified and trapped. Look — they rejected the word of the LORD, so what kind of wisdom could they possibly have?

verses.kjv: Therefore will I give their wives unto others, and their fields to them that shall inherit them: for every one from the least even unto the greatest is given to covetousness, from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.
verses.web: Therefore I will give their wives to others and their fields to those who will possess them. For everyone from the least even to the greatest is given to covetousness; from the prophet even to the priest everyone deals falsely.
verses.ct: Because of this, I will hand their wives over to other men and their fields to new owners. From the lowest to the highest, everyone is greedy for dishonest gain. From prophet to priest, every one of them is a fraud.

verses.kjv: For they have healed the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.
verses.web: They have healed the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly, saying, “Peace, peace,” when there is no peace.
verses.ct: They treat the wounds of my people as if they were nothing serious, saying, "Everything is fine! Everything is fine!" — when nothing is fine at all.

verses.kjv: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore shall they fall among them that fall: in the time of their visitation they shall be cast down, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? No, they were not at all ashamed. They couldn’t blush. Therefore they will fall among those who fall. In the time of their visitation they will be cast down, says LORD.
verses.ct: Were they ashamed of the disgusting things they did? Not in the least — they didn't even know how to blush. So they will fall along with everyone else who falls. When I come to judge them, they will be brought down," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: I will surely consume them, saith the LORD: there shall be no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the fig tree, and the leaf shall fade; and the things that I have given them shall pass away from them.
verses.web: “ ‘I will utterly consume them, says LORD. No grapes will be on the vine, no figs on the fig tree, and the leaf will fade. The things that I have given them will pass away from them.’ ”
verses.ct: "I will completely destroy them," says the LORD. "There will be no grapes left on the vine, no figs on the fig tree, and even the leaves will wither. Everything I gave them will be taken away.'"

verses.kjv: Why do we sit still? assemble yourselves, and let us enter into the defenced cities, and let us be silent there: for the LORD our God hath put us to silence, and given us water of gall to drink, because we have sinned against the LORD.
verses.web: “Why do we sit still? Assemble yourselves! Let’s enter into the fortified cities, and let’s be silent there; for LORD our God has put us to silence, and given us poisoned water to drink, because we have sinned against LORD.
verses.ct: The people will say, "Why are we just sitting here? Let's gather together and flee to the fortified cities! If we're going to die, let's die there — because the LORD our God has condemned us. He's given us poisoned water to drink because we sinned against the LORD.

verses.kjv: We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of health, and behold trouble!
verses.web: We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and behold, dismay!
verses.ct: We hoped for peace, but nothing good came. We waited for a time of healing, but instead — terror!

verses.kjv: The snorting of his horses was heard from Dan: the whole land trembled at the sound of the neighing of his strong ones; for they are come, and have devoured the land, and all that is in it; the city, and those that dwell therein.
verses.web: The snorting of his horses is heard from Dan. The whole land trembles at the sound of the neighing of his strong ones; for they have come, and have devoured the land and all that is in it, the city and those who dwell therein.”
verses.ct: The snorting of enemy horses can already be heard from Dan. The whole land shakes at the sound of their stallions neighing. They've come and devoured the land and everything in it — the cities and everyone who lives there."

verses.kjv: For, behold, I will send serpents, cockatrices, among you, which will not be charmed, and they shall bite you, saith the LORD.
verses.web: “For, behold, I will send serpents, adders among you, which will not be charmed; and they will bite you,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Watch — I am sending venomous snakes among you, deadly vipers that no one can charm, and they will bite you," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: When I would comfort myself against sorrow, my heart is faint in me.
verses.web: Oh that I could comfort myself against sorrow! My heart is faint within me.
verses.ct: My grief is beyond comfort. My heart is sick inside me.

verses.kjv: Behold the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people because of them that dwell in a far country: Is not the LORD in Zion? is not her king in her? Why have they provoked me to anger with their graven images, and with strange vanities?
verses.web: Behold, the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people from a land that is very far off: “Isn’t LORD in Zion? Isn’t her King in her?” “Why have they provoked me to anger with their engraved images, and with foreign idols?”
verses.ct: Listen! The cries of my people rise from a distant land: "Isn't the LORD in Zion? Isn't her King still there?" And the LORD responds, "Why have they provoked me to anger with their carved idols and their worthless foreign gods?"

verses.kjv: The harvest is past, the summer is ended, and we are not saved.
verses.web: “The harvest is past. The summer has ended, and we are not saved.”
verses.ct: The people cry out, "The harvest is over, the summer has ended, and still we are not saved."

verses.kjv: For the hurt of the daughter of my people am I hurt; I am black; astonishment hath taken hold on me.
verses.web: For the hurt of the daughter of my people, I am hurt. I mourn. Dismay has taken hold of me.
verses.ct: I am shattered by the suffering of my people. I am dressed in mourning. Horror has gripped me.

verses.kjv: Is there no balm in Gilead; is there no physician there? why then is not the health of the daughter of my people recovered?
verses.web: Is there no balm in Gilead? Is there no physician there? Why then isn’t the health of the daughter of my people recovered?
verses.ct: Is there no healing balm in Gilead? Is there no doctor there? Then why hasn't my people's wound been healed?
